attributes.action: regulate the UK airlines to remove excessive credit card charges
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The UK airline industry has become unique in forcing the majority of customers to pay excessive charges just to pay for their flights. It is now even common for airlines to charge when payment is made using a debit card. In this case the banks charge 15p - 50p per tranaction and yet a consumer buying 2 x £200 flights will be forced to pay over £13 just for paying for the flights. The loophole of offering zero charges for paying with Visa Electron is not acceptable as they are virtually impossible to obtain in the UK.

As such we the undersigned wish the insist on fair payment charges
